1.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father; But a foolish son is the grief of his mother.

2.text: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing; But righteousness delivereth from death.

3.text: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish; But He thrusteth away the desire of the wicked.

4.text: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand; But the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

5.text: A wise son gathereth in summer; But a son that doeth shamefully sleepeth in harvest.

6.text: Blessings are upon the head of the righteous; But the mouth of the wicked concealeth violence.

7.text: The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing; But the name of the wicked shall rot.

8.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments; But a prating fool shall fall.

9.text: He that walketh uprightly walketh securely; But he that perverteth his ways shall be found out.

10.text: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow; And a prating fool shall fall.

11.text: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life; But the mouth of the wicked concealeth violence.

12.text: Hatred stirreth up strifes; But love covereth all transgressions.

13.text: In the lips of him that hath discernment wisdom is found; But a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

14.text: Wise men lay up knowledge; But the mouth of the foolish is an imminent ruin.

15.text: The rich manâ€™s wealth is his strong city; The ruin of the poor is their poverty.

16.text: The wages of the righteous is life; The increase of the wicked is sin.

17.text: He is in the way of life that heedeth instruction; But he that forsaketh reproof erreth.

18.text: He that hideth hatred is of lying lips; And he that uttereth a slander is a fool.

19.text: In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression; But he that refraineth his lips is wise.

20.text: The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver; The heart of the wicked is little worth.

21.text: The lips of the righteous feed many; But the foolish die for want of understanding.

22.text: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, And toil addeth nothing thereto.

23.text: It is as sport to a fool to do wickedness, And so is wisdom to a man of discernment.

24.text: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him; And the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

25.text: When the whirlwind passeth, the wicked is no more; But the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

26.text: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, So is the sluggard to them that send him.

27.text: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days; But the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

28.text: The hope of the righteous is gladness; But the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

29.text: The way of the LORD is a stronghold to the upright, But ruin to the workers of iniquity.

30.text: The righteous shall never be moved; But the wicked shall not inhabit the land.

31.text: The mouth of the righteous buddeth with wisdom; But the froward tongue shall be cut off.

32.text: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable; But the mouth of the wicked is all frowardness.
